perturbation.original_text:
6.  PAYMENT TERMS.

     6.1  Payments.  The parties shall make the payments described in Exhibit A. Overdue payments shall accrue interest, at the lesser of 1 1/2% per month or the maximum allowable interest under applicable law, from due date until paid, and the owing party shall pay the owed party's costs of collection (including reasonable attorneys' fees).
perturbation.changed_text:
6.  PAYMENT TERMS.

     6.1  Payments.  The parties shall make the payments described in Exhibit A. Overdue payments shall accrue interest at a fixed rate of 5% per annum, regardless of applicable law, from due date until paid. The owing party is not responsible for any collection costs.
perturbation.explanation: This creates a contradiction by specifying a fixed annual interest rate of 5%, regardless of applicable law, which conflicts with the original clause that uses a monthly rate capped by the maximum allowable interest under applicable law. Additionally, it removes the responsibility of the owing party to pay for collection costs, directly contradicting the original.

The added clause gives 'theglobe' the sole discretion to delay or adjust payment amounts, conflicting with the established fixed schedule of payments and introducing uncertainty about the actual payment terms. The original terms specify fixed payments at specific times. This addition allows for those terms to be unilaterally changed.

perturbation.original_text: 6.3  Audit Rights.  A party obligated to make payments hereunder shall keep for 3 years proper records and books of account relating to the computation of such payments.  Once every 12 months, the party receiving payment or its designee may inspect such records to verify reports.  Any such inspection will be conducted in a manner that does not unreasonably interfere with the inspected party's business activities.  The inspected party shall immediately make any overdue payments disclosed by the audit plus applicable interest.  Such inspection shall be at the inspecting party's expense; however, if the audit reveals overdue payments in excess of 5% of the payments owed to date, the inspected party shall immediately pay the cost of such audit, and the inspecting party may conduct another audit during the same 12 month period.
perturbation.changed_text: 6.3  Audit Rights.  A party obligated to make payments hereunder shall keep for 1 year proper records and books of account relating to the computation of such payments.  Once every 36 months, the party receiving payment or its designee may inspect such records to verify reports.  Any such inspection will be conducted in a manner that unreasonably interferes with the inspected party's business activities.  The inspected party shall have 30 days to make any overdue payments disclosed by the audit without accruing interest.  Such inspection shall always be at the inspecting party's expense, regardless of the audit findings.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces multiple conflicts: shortening the record-keeping period from 3 years to 1 year, decreasing audit frequency from every 12 months to every 36 months, removing the restriction that audits not unreasonably interfere with business activities, providing a 30-day grace period for overdue payments without interest (contradicting Section 6.1), and stating that the inspecting party always bears the audit cost. These create substantial ambiguities and contradictions regarding audit procedures, grace periods, and payment obligations.
